LiftingSurface¶

class components.liftingsurfaces.primitives.liftingsurface.LiftingSurface(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

This script will generate a lifting surface primitive for the KBE app. The surface type can be straight, tapered and swept. In the future, we would like to add functionality for elliptical wings. The required inputs for each instantiation are the Wing Area, Aspect Ratio, Taper Ratio, TE offset , dihedral angle, wing twist and airfoil DAT file. Possible airfoils are in the folder ‘airfoils’, then within another folder, either ‘cambered’, ‘reflexed’, or ‘symmetric’. Feel free to add new airfoils. Also note, this primitive is instantiated in ‘wing.py’, where you can perform an AVL analysis. The sign convention is +x pointing with direction of chord, +y pointing toward right wingtip, +z up.

Returns:

ParaPy Geometry of a Lifting Surface
Parameters:
  • planform_area (float) – This is the Required Planfrom Area [m^2]
  • aspect_ratio (float) – This is the required Aspect Ratio of the Surface.
  • taper (float) – This is the required Taper Ratio of the Surface.
  • dihedral (float) – This is the required Dihedral Angle of the Surface in degrees.
  • twist (float) – This is the required Twist Angle of the Tip Airfoil w.r.t the Root Airfoil in degrees.
  • offset (float or NoneType) – This is the offset in the flow direction of the tip W.R.T. the root Leading Edge.
  • browse_airfoils – Allows the user to easily choose amongst available airfoils with a GUI File-Browser.
  • hide_mac (bool) – This allows the MAC curve to be shown on the wing when changed in the GUI to False.
  • hide_leading_edge (bool) – This allows the leading edge line to be shown (without dihedral).
  • is_half (bool) – A switch case that determines if the planform_area is half of the total required area.
  • mesh_deflection (float) – The default value is an optimum between a good quality render and performance.
  • airfoil_type (str) – This is the name of the folder within the ‘airfoils’ folder. There are three options ‘cambered’, ‘reflexed’ and ‘symmetric’.
  • airfoil_choice (str) – This is the filename of the requested airfoil.
aerodynamic_center[source]¶

This attribute finds the aerodynamic center assuming it lies at 0.25*MAC.

Returns:Aerodynamic Center Position of wing component. ParaPy Point
Return type:Point
airfoil[source]¶

This creates an Airfoil from the DAT file.

Returns:Airfoil fitted curve ParaPy Geometry
Return type:FittedCurve
airfoil_choice¶

Below is the default airfoil. Please see the three folders to find the correct filename, if you wish to change the airfoil.

airfoil_data[source]¶

This reads and scans the user chosen Airfoil DAT file from the database and stores it as airfoil_data.

Returns:Airfoil Data Points (Tuple List of Points)
Return type:List
airfoil_type¶

Below is the name of the folder within the ‘airfoils’ folder. There are three options: ‘cambered’, ‘reflexed’ and ‘symmetric’.

aspect_ratio¶

Below is the required Aspect Ratio of the Surface.

bottom_z_loc[source]¶

This attribute computes the bottom surface of the root airfoil.

Returns:Z-location of the root chord bottom surface
Return type:float
browse_airfoils[source]¶

Allows the user to easily choose amongst available airfoils with a GUI File-Browser.

Returns:Sets the inputs airfoil_type and airfoil_choice above to the value chosen in the GUI Browser
dihedral¶

Below is the User chosen Dihedral Angle.

dihedral_solid[source]¶

This rotates the entire solid wing half over the dihedral angle.

Returns:ParaPy rotated lofted solid wing geometry.
Return type:RotatedShape
front_spar_line[source]¶

This attribute creates a spar line frm the root airfoils cog to the tip airfoils cog

Returns:Spar Line
Return type:LineSegment
hide_leading_edge¶

Boolean below allows the leading edge line to be shown (without dihedral).

hide_mac¶

Boolean below allows the MAC curve to be shown on the wing when changed in the GUI to False.

is_half¶

A switch case that determines if the planform_area is half of the total required area

le_sweep[source]¶

This will calculate the leading edge sweep of the wing.

Returns:Wing LE sweep in degrees
Return type:float
leading_edge[source]¶

This makes a line indicating the leading edge (for a wing without dihedral).

Returns:Wing leading edge ParaPy Geometry
Return type:LineSegment
lemac[source]¶

Quickly calculates the Leading Edge Mean Aerodynamic Chord by sorting through all sample_points of the part mac_airfoil and selects the one with the minimum x (thus closest to the flight direction which is x)

Returns:Location of the Leading Edge Mean Aerodynamic Chord in SI meter
Return type:Tuple
mac_airfoil[source]¶

This finds the mean aerodynamic chord wing section by using a plane intersecting the rotated wing half. The location of this cut is found above. (Note: to see this on the wing, you must change hide_mac to True)

Returns:ParaPy MAC airfoil.
Return type:IntersectedShapes
mac_length[source]¶

This attribute finds the length of the MAC using the bbox of the intersected shape. This is used instead of the normal equation for the MAC for a tapered wing.

Returns:MAC length
Return type:float
mac_span_calc[source]¶

This will determine the spanwise location of the Mean Aerodynamic Chord with respect to the root airfoil.

Returns:Wing Spanwise MAC position
Return type:float
mac_x[source]¶

This will determine the x relative position of the MAC WRT the wing root. Thus, it must be added to the position of the wing root.

Returns:Wing Flow direction MAC position
Return type:float
mac_z[source]¶

This will determine the z relative position of the MAC WRT the wing root. Thus, it must be added to the position of the wing root.

Returns:Wing z direction MAC position
Return type:float
mesh_deflection¶

The default value is an optimum between a good quality render and performance.

no_dihedral_solid[source]¶

This generates a solid wing half with the sign convention mentioned above.

Returns:ParaPy lofted solid wing geometry.
Return type:LoftedSolid
offset¶

Below is the offset in the flow direction of the tip W.R.T. the root Leading Edge. The default input (None) causes the TE to be unswept (offset = c_r-c_t), however, if the user inputs 0 in the GUI, then the leading edge becomes unswept. In this case, with taper ratio < 1, the TE becomes forward swept.

planform_area¶

Below is the Required Planfrom Area, if mirrored is true then this is the total wing area

root_airfoil[source]¶

This scales the original airfoil to required root chord.

Returns:Root Airfoil scaled curve ParaPy Geometry
Return type:ScaledCurve
root_chord[source]¶

This attribute calculates the required root chord, with an assumed taper ratio.

Returns:Wing Root Chord in SI meter
Return type:float
scaled_tip[source]¶

This scales the original airfoil to the required tip chord.

Returns:Tip Airfoil scaled curve ParaPy Geometry
Return type:ScaledCurve
semi_span[source]¶

This attribute calculates the required semi-span based on the wing area and Aspect Ratio.

Returns:Wing Semispan in SI meter
Return type:float
solid[source]¶

This translates the entire solid wing half to make the bottom surface flush with the origin

Returns:ParaPy rotated lofted solid wing geometry.
Return type:TranslatedShape
span[source]¶

This attribute calculates the required wingspan based on the wing area and Aspect Ratio.

Returns:Wing Span in SI meter
Return type:float
taper¶

Below is the Taper Ratio, which is chosen by the user.

tip_airfoil[source]¶

This rotates the tip airfoil over the wing twist angle input. The rotation is about the leading edge.

Returns:Tip Airfoil in position without twist ParaPy Geometry
Return type:TransformedCurve
tip_airfoil_notwist[source]¶

This positions another tip airfoil with respect to the required semispan & requested/standard offset. It does not yet incorporate twist.

Returns:Tip Airfoil in position without twist ParaPy Geometry
Return type:TransformedCurve
tip_chord[source]¶

This attribute calculates the tip chord, with the assumed taper ratio and the root chord.

Returns:Wing Tip Chord in SI meter
Return type:float
tip_offset[source]¶

Below is the offset in the flow direction of the tip W.R.T. the root Leading Edge. The default input (None) causes the TE to be unswept (offset = cr - ct), however, if the user inputs 0 in the GUI, then the leading edge becomes unswept. In this case, with taper ratio < 1, the TE becomes forward swept.

Returns:Offset between tip and root leading edges
Return type:float
twist¶

Below is the twist of the tip section with respect to the root section. Positive twist is tip twisted up with respect to the root.
